title: Business Intelligence Developer, Ambulatory Transformation and Performance
description:
DescriptionThe Ambulatory Ops Business Intelligence Developer is an integral member of the Ambulatory Transformation and Performance (ATP) team, responsible for developing and delivering advanced reporting and analytics solutions to support the ATP mission in ensuring the efficient operation of ambulatory clinics to enhance financial viability, optimize performance, and foster informed, data-driven decision-making. This senior technical expert leads the design, implementation, and optimization of clinical informatics systems, with a focus on solving complex technical problems and mentoring junior analysts. The incumbent collaborates closely with clinical, technical, and business teams to ensure data integrity and system reliability, driving the development of actionable insights through advanced analytics. Responsible for developing reporting and analytics solutions for the department/health system users by gathering business needs, documenting requirements, identifying appropriate data sources, developing reports and dashboards, and delivering them to stakeholders. This involves designing and writing of new and/or modifying the existing applications to facilitate goals and meet information and automation needs of department/health system users. Interacts with key stakeholders, leadership, and subject matter experts to develop a deep understanding of analytical needs and translates requirements into business intelligence solutions that drive business decisions, insight, and outcomes through actionable, easy-to-read dashboards and reports.

• Lead the development and optimization of complex SQL queries, views, and stored procedures for data analysis and reporting for ambulatory operations
• Design, develop, and perform thorough functional testing of reports and dashboards utilizing reporting tools and data sources such as CDW/Clarity, Reporting Workbench, Data Marts, Tableau, and other Business Intelligence Tools.
• Monitor the performance of reports and take corrective action to optimize or improve the performance when necessary.
• Perform advanced quality assurance testing and document system changes to ensure high standards of performance.
• Track operational metrics and perform sensitivity analysis to explain the contribution of factors affecting various measures.
• Assess the impact of attributes (e.g., physicians, departments, practice locations) on measures at both summary and drill-down levels.
• Serve as a subject matter expert in clinical informatics, providing advanced technical support and troubleshooting.
• Lead the development and implementation of the organization's clinical information systems and tools, ensuring they align with the needs of ambulatory operations.
• Collaborate with business, technical, and clinical leaders to plan, develop, implement, and analyze complex clinical informatics systems.
• Design integrated architecture to ensure optimal user experience, functionality, integrity, and reliability of systems.
• Manage the operational analytics program life cycle through initiation, planning, validation, execution, and deployment.
• Lead project teams, including advanced business and clinical staff, to improve clinical informatics results and provide sophisticated metrics and analytics to support management’s decision-making processes.
• Provide operational analysis and calculate physician productivity; produce the PSRA Summary Report.
• Produce monthly Tableau dashboards for senior department leadership and ambulatory operations directors, focusing on referral leakage, KPI metrics, new patient lag days, exam room utilization, and financial and operational trends.
• Assist in the collection of data from clinic and division Managers, Operations Directors, Departmental Finance, and other offices.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs for reporting requests. Gather requirements, document, clarify, and interpret specifications, reviewing for completeness and accuracy.
• Work closely and collaboratively with end-users and other stakeholders to ensure the right reporting tools are used to maximize value.
• Provide guidance to other team members to promote the use of published data reports.
• Work with end-users to resolve problems promptly, ensuring tasks are completed with quality and within expected timeframes.
• Provide ongoing user training and produce and deliver user training curricula.

Salary range: $102500- $227700

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
Position Title: Microsoft Power BI Developer
Type: Temporary / Contract
Pay Rate: $70.00 – $90.00 per hour
Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (Hybrid – 2 days onsite, 3 days remote)
Duration: 6+ months
Start Date: ASAP
Industry: Public Sector

Position Overview
This public-sector organization is seeking a highly skilled Microsoft Power BI Developer to support ongoing data modernization and analytics initiatives. The role partners closely with business and technical stakeholders to design, develop, and deliver executive and operational dashboards using Microsoft Power BI, supported by Microsoft SQL Server and multiple line-of-business applications and databases.

The ideal candidate combines strong technical development expertise with the analytical ability to translate complex business requirements into actionable, data-driven solutions.

Key Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports for executive, management, and operational audiences
• Develop and optimize SQL scripts, views, and stored procedures to support ETL processes from multiple source systems
• Integrate data from multiple line-of-business applications and databases into centralized reporting structures
• Partner with business and technical stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document reporting and analytics requirements
• Translate functional and business needs into technical designs and scalable data models
• Ensure data accuracy, performance optimization, and compliance with data governance standards
• Support ongoing dashboard enhancements, refinements, and operational reporting needs

Required Skills & Qualifications
• Proven experience developing dashboards and reports using Microsoft Power BI
• Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server, including T-SQL, views, and stored procedures
• Experience building or supporting data warehouses and data integration pipelines
• Ability to write and maintain ETL or data import scripts from multiple source systems
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail
• Demonstrated experience working directly with stakeholders to document and refine business requirements
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Preferred Qualifications
• Five or more years of experience supporting executive-level and operational dashboards
• Familiarity with enterprise or public-sector line-of-business systems such as Yardi Voyager
• Experience supporting reporting environments within large, regulated organizations

title: Business Application Developer
description:
Business Applications Developer

About Spinelli Kilcollin:
Spinelli Kilcollin is a luxury jewelry brand based in Los Angeles, known for designing linked rings, clean architectural designs, and a commitment to responsible craftsmanship. Founded in 2010, our collections are handcrafted in downtown L.A., with a focus on creating a positive long-term impact—on our industry, our community, and our customers.

Overview
We are seeking a talented Business Applications Developer to design, build, and maintain integrations and customizations across our enterprise business platforms, including NetSuite ERP, ShipStation, CRM, Shopify, HR/Payroll, Finance, and collaboration systems. This role requires a deep understanding of enterprise systems, data integration, and automation. You will play a key role in optimizing business workflows, driving efficiency, and ensuring seamless communication between critical applications.

Location: Los Angeles (Hybrid)

Reports To: COO (in partnership with VP of People)

Key Responsibilities

Systems Architecture & Integration
• Architect, develop, and maintain integrations between NetSuite, Shopify, HR/Payroll, CRM, Finance, and other enterprise platforms.
• Design and implement scalable integration modules, reusable components, and data sync pipelines connecting internal and third-party systems.
• Develop APIs, workflows, and automation using REST/SOAP, SQL, and platform-specific SDKs.
• Lead and support ERP upgrades, patches, and performance tuning initiatives within NetSuite and related system migrations (IE: Dropbox → Google Drive).
• Implement automated monitoring, logging, and error handling to ensure reliable and transparent integrations.
• Manage system deployments and participate in SDLC activities, including code reviews, QA, and documentation.

Platform Development & Customization
• Build and maintain NetSuite customizations, including SuiteScripts, workflows, forms, and data transformations.
• Design and develop SQL-based reports, dashboards, and stored procedures using tools such as Power BI, BigQuery, and NetSuite Analytics.
• Customize and extend applications to improve financial, HR, and operational processes.
• Support and enhance integrations between NetSuite and external platforms, such as ShipStation, Shopify, HubSpot, and collaboration tools.
• Administer user roles, permissions, SSO architecture, and enterprise security systems.

Automation & Internal Tools
• Develop internal tools, scripts, and automation solutions leveraging APIs and AI platforms such as ChatGPT Enterprise.
• Implement and maintain monitoring/logging systems for proactive system health management.
• Create and manage automated data transformation and backup workflows across enterprise systems.

Collaboration & Business Support
• Partner with business leaders, operations, and web to translate requirements into scalable, maintainable solutions.
• Provide Tier 2 support for system issues, performing root-cause analysis and implementing long-term fixes.
• Identify inefficiencies and automate workflows to enhance operational effectiveness.
• Maintain comprehensive documentation for integrations, configurations, and deployment processes.
• Support testing, validation, and user acceptance phases during system enhancements and upgrades.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
• 3–5+ years of experience in enterprise system development, ERP customization, and/or application integration.
• Hands-on experience with NetSuite ERP — including SuiteScript development, SuiteFlow automation, and integration with external systems.
• Strong programming skills in JavaScript, Python, C#, Java, or Go, with proficiency in SQL and REST API development.
• Experience designing and maintaining integrations using platforms such as Dell Boomi, MuleSoft, Celigo, or custom middleware.
• Solid understanding of data management, database architecture, and SDLC best practices.
• Excellent communication and documentation skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments.

Preferred Skills
• Familiarity with Microsoft Graph API, Retool, or similar low-code application frameworks.
• Experience with retail and physical inventory-based industry.
• Experience with AI/automation tools, enterprise search (e.g., Elasticsearch), or RAG-based solutions.
• Experience with CRM platforms such as HubSpot and Braze is a strong plus.
• Professional certification in NetSuite is a strong plus.

Why Join Us
As a Business Applications Developer, you’ll be at the center of our enterprise technology ecosystem - empowering teams through smarter integrations, modern automation, and optimized workflows. If you’re passionate about leveraging NetSuite and other leading platforms to deliver meaningful business impact, we want to hear from you.

Compensation: $140,000 - $180,000

Benefits:
• Paid Company Holidays
• PTO
• Health & Dental Benefits
• 401(k) + matching
• Profit sharing + Annual Bonus
• Jewelry Allowance

How To Apply:
Send your resume and a cover letter to careers@spinellikilcollin.com. Please include three cultural figures who inspire you in any creative field and why. Impeccable references are required.

Applicants must submit the materials above directly to careers@spinellikilcollin.com for consideration.

We look forward to receiving your application and learning more about how you can contribute to Spinelli Kilcollin!

title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
description:
About the position
As a Senior Business Intelligence Developer, you will lead the design, development, and support of enterprise analytics solutions on the Strategy (MicroStrategy) platform. You will partner with Finance and other stakeholders to translate requirements into secure, performant dossiers, dashboards, reports, and automated distributions; maintain and enhance the Strategy metadata and semantic layer and drive modernization efforts from legacy reporting tools to strategic BI platforms. You will mentor other developers, establish development standards, and collaborate with Data Engineering and Technology Services to ensure high data quality, governance, and reliable production operations.
Responsibilities
• Design, build, and enhance Strategy dossiers, dashboards, and reports using prompts, filters, drill paths, and guided navigation.
• Partner with data architects and engineers to develop and maintain Strategy schema and metadata objects (attributes, facts, hierarchies) and reusable enterprise-aligned metrics.
• Implement scheduling, subscriptions, alerts, and thresholds using Strategy Distribution Services to deliver timely insights.
• Manage the full analytics object lifecycle, including development, testing, documentation, and promotion to production using packaging, migration, and change management best practices.
• Optimize performance through SQL and VLDB tuning, intelligent cube design, caching strategies, and proactive troubleshooting of production issues.
• Promote self-service analytics by standardizing templates and visual standards, training users, and consulting on KPI definition and dashboard design.
• Partner with business owners and data engineers to define and implement data quality rules, reconciliation checks, and validation processes.
• Build and maintain data quality dashboards and scorecards to monitor data health and issue resolution.
• Develop and operate monitoring for Strategy jobs, including cube builds, refreshes, and distributions.
• Create and maintain runbooks for incident response, troubleshooting, and continuous improvement.
• Support data governance by documenting data definitions and lineage, enforcing access controls, and supporting audits and compliance activities.
• Lead migration and modernization of legacy reporting to Strategy, ensuring functional parity while improving usability and performance.
• Act as the Strategy subject-matter expert for upgrades and environment changes, coordinating testing, documentation, and stakeholder communications.
• Partner with internal clients, IT, and Financial Systems to deliver effective reporting solutions and develop new BI capabilities aligned with strategic goals.
• Mentor developers and power users, establishing reusable components, standards, and automation (e.g., Strategy SDK/REST API, scripting) to improve productivity.

Requirements
• 7+ years of experience in data analysis and business intelligence, including 5+ years of enterprise MicroStrategy (Strategy) development.
• Advanced MicroStrategy expertise (Workstation/Developer), including metadata and schema design, metrics/dossiers/reports, security configuration (groups, ACLs, filters), and Distribution Services.
• Strong relational database and expert-level SQL skills, including performance tuning and complex query troubleshooting.
• Hands-on experience with BI SDLC best practices: dev/test/prod promotions, change control, and documentation.
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Accounting, Business, or equivalent experience.
• Strong analytical, data modeling, and visualization skills, with the ability to communicate insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
• Proven ability to manage multiple priorities with high attention to detail, data quality, and stakeholder engagement, including senior leadership and C-level executives.

Nice-to-haves
• Exposure to Strategy REST APIs/SDKs, automation, or embedded analytics preferred.
• 3+ years of Tableau development experience (Desktop, Server, or Cloud).
• Familiarity with Power BI and SAP BusinessObjects/Crystal Reports a plus, especially for BI platform migrations.
• Experience with Elite 3E or legal/financial systems strongly preferred.

Benefits
• MoFo offers a comprehensive benefits package starting on your first day.
• A variety of options for medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverage to meet the needs of you and your family.
• Industry-leading parental leave and family benefits including adoption and fertility treatment options and backup child and elder care.
• Global wellness program, including free access to Talkspace and Calm apps.
• Annual community service day to make an impact on your community and a birthday holiday just for fun.
• Education reimbursement annually.
• Dedicated Talent Development team.
• Competitive annual profit-sharing contribution.

title: BI SQL Analytics Developer
description:
For more than 70 years, the Motion Picture Industry Pension & Health Plans (MPI) has proudly served the entertainment community by supporting the financial and healthcare well-being of the people who bring stories to life — from set crews to post-production pros.
We’re not just analysts and data experts; we’re problem-solvers, collaborators, and stewards of trust. Our teams are guided by a simple mission: to improve the lives of those who work in the entertainment industry through accuracy, accountability, and care.
MPI is recognized as a four-time certified Great Place to Work® employer and recipient of the World at Work Seal of Distinction because we believe people do their best work when they’re respected, supported, and inspired.

Role Overview:
We are seeking a BI/SQL Analytics Developer to become a member of our IT department in Studio City. This hybrid role requires an independent contributor who will be responsible for the design, development, and support of enterprise analytics and business intelligence solutions.
This position plays an integral part in developing and supporting analytics platforms including Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Alteryx, and SSIS. Successful candidates will have the ability to leverage strong SQL skills to deliver trusted, governed, and scalable data solutions. You’ll work closely with business users to translate requirements into actionable insights while ensuring data quality, performance, and compliance.
*Local candidates only, relocation assistance is not provided. We do not offer visa sponsorship for this job classification.
Qualified candidates, please submit your current resume with a cover letter and your compensation requirements for consideration.
Submissions will be reviewed; only candidates most closely matching the requirements of the position will be contacted.

What You Will Need:
• 7+ years of hands-on experience as a SQL Developer or Data Analyst
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems/Technology or a related field; or equivalent combination of education, training, and related experience.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
• Strong experience in building and maintaining data pipelines using MS Fabric, model and transform data using Fabric Lakehouse/Warehouse.
• Experience in documenting data models, reports, pipeline logic, and understanding of data warehousing concepts and best practices.
• Strong experience with Power BI, including data preparation, data modeling, DAX, and report optimization, with the ability to develop and maintain paginated reports using Power BI report Builder for operational and detailed reporting needs.
• Strong Alteryx experience, including workflow development, optimization, and operational support
• Proficiency in maintaining and supporting SSIS packages is required
• Experience administering and supporting Alteryx Server, including upgrades, MongoDB backups, and issue resolution
• Advanced-level Microsoft Excel skills for analyzing datasets and identifying trends or inconsistencies
• Experience providing production support for BI and analytics solutions
• Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to work well with individuals at all levels of the organization.
• Excellent attendance and reliability, with the ability to work extended hours as needed.
• Ability to accept direction and developmental guidance from supervisor.
• Experience in regulated industries such as insurance, healthcare, and financial services preferred.
• Experience supporting self-service BI and governed analytics environments and a familiarity with modern data governance/compliance preferred.

What You’ll Do:
• Design, develop, and deliver interactive Power BI datasets, dashboards, reports, and stories that are easily understood
• Build, deploy, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines using SSIS, Alteryx, and Microsoft Fabric
• Design, create, and optimize complex SQL queries, views, and stored procedures
• Design, develop, deploy, and manage Alteryx workflows and analytic applications
• Provide daily operational and production support for Power BI, Alteryx, and other BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
• Ensure data quality, reliability, performance, and scalability across analytics solutions
• Apply data governance, lineage, sensitivity labeling, and compliance standards using Microsoft Purview
• Ensure regulatory compliance (HIPAA and other applicable regulations) in all aspects of data utilization and access
• Collaborate with business users and IT partners to translate requirements into effective analytics solutions
• Communicate professionally with technical and non-technical audiences through written, verbal, and formal presentations.
• Participate in design and peer reviews within the department
• Stay current with BI and data analytics trends, tools, and best practices

Compensation & Benefits:
The anticipated base salary for this position is $105,000 - $125,000 annually. The actual base salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held.

MPI offers a comprehensive benefits package, including free medical, dental, and vision coverage, generous paid time off, retirement benefits, and professional development opportunities.
MPI requires employees to be vaccinated against Covid-19 with exceptions as required by law.

title: Senior BI Developer II
description:
About the position
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Developer II to join our Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing team. The ideal candidate will possess extensive hands-on experience with Snowflake, AWS Lambda, REST API development, and Node.js, and will have a strong background in financial or accounting data environments. In this senior-level role, you will be responsible for architecting, developing, and maintaining robust data solutions and driving innovation across our data warehouse and reporting platforms.
Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines and ETL processes using Snowflake, AWS Lambda, and Node.js to support financial and accounting reporting needs.
• Build, enhance, and maintain RESTful APIs for seamless data integration and delivery across various financial systems.
• Monitor and troubleshoot existing business intelligence (BI) applications, frameworks, and reports to ensure data availability and reliability for end users.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, design solutions, and implement dashboards, reports, and solutions that address business needs.
• Analyze and cleanse large datasets to ensure data accuracy, quality, and reconciliation to the original sources; perform quality assurance testing prior to data/report release.
• Develop, maintain, and deliver comprehensive technical documentation related to data pipelines, ETL processes, scheduled jobs, dataset creation, and reporting solutions.
• Provide technical mentorship to junior developers and analysts, fostering a collaborative and innovative team environment.
• Identify and troubleshoot data anomalies, performance bottlenecks, and system issues in a timely manner.

Requirements
• Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 6 years and a Master's degree; or a PhD with 3 years experience; or equivalent experience.
• Strong proficiency in SQL programming, with demonstrated experience in query optimization, data modeling, and performance tuning.
• Advanced skills in Node.js and Python for cross team collaboration.
• Extensive experience with REST API development.
• Proven ability to analyze complex datasets, ensure data quality, and deliver reconciled, validated results.
• Experience in gathering and documenting cross-functional requirements, translating business needs into technical deliverables.
• Excellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
• Attention to detail, accuracy, and a commitment to data privacy and security best practices.
• Background in financial or accounting analytics, reporting, or regulatory environments.
• Knowledge of indexing, high-performance data concepts, and cloud-based data architectures.

Nice-to-haves
• Experience with Tableau is a plus.
• Experience with additional database technologies such as PostgreSQL and DynamoDB features.

Benefits
• In addition to a competitive base salary, discretionary target cash bonus, and restricted stock units (subject to Board Approval). EVgo offers a comprehensive benefits package including health, life, and disability insurance, unbounded paid time off including parental leave, and a 401(k).

title: Lead BI Developer
description:
BASE SALARY: $120,000 to $150,000 per year
MUST HAVE:
• Experience BI, analytics, or marketing/data science roles with digital marketing exposure.
• Experience in digital media or performance marketing industries
• Advanced SQL and Looker proficiency.
• Strong business acumen and cross-functional communication skills.

EXPERIENCE: Minimum of 5 years in business intelligence or analytics in digital media or performance marketing.
YOUR ROLE
Deliver actionable business intelligence and strategic insights that drive revenue and margin growth across Launch Potato's digital properties.
Outcomes (Performance Expectations)
• Clean, standardize, and document stakeholder-facing dashboards in Looker with aligned definitions and metrics within the first 60 days.
• Identify and resolve at least five inconsistencies or discrepancies in reporting logic within the first 90 days.
• Partner with FP&A and product teams to ensure 100% alignment between financial and operational data by the end of the second quarter.
• Deliver ad hoc strategic analyses with clear financial or strategic recommendations, averaging one per month.
• Lead and document improvements to at least two core Looker Explores or dashboard structures to enable scalable self-service by end of H1.

Competencies
• Analytical Rigor: Seeks data integrity and challenges assumptions to ensure accuracy.
• Business Acumen: Ties insights to outcomes; thinks beyond the dashboard.
• Communication: Distills complex data into simple narratives for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Ownership: Delivers timely insights and updates; proactively surfaces blockers or gaps.
• Collaboration: Forms strong partnerships across product, media, and finance teams.

TOTAL COMPENSATION
Base salary is set according to market rates for the nearest major metro and varies based on Launch Potato's Levels Framework. Your compensation package includes a base salary, profit-sharing bonus, and competitive benefits. Launch Potato is a performance-driven company, which means once you are hired, future increases will be based on company and personal performance, not annual cost of living adjustments.

title: Healthcare BI Developer
description:
Healthcare BI DeveloperOpportunity!!

This Jobot Consulting Job is hosted by: Robert Reyes
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $45 - $57 per hour

A bit about us:

Prestige Hospital System
Placed #1 in both California in a broad assessment of excellence in hospital-based patient care.

Why join us?

Competitive Salary$$
Stellar Benefits (Medical, Dental Vision, Life Insurance)
Flexible Schedule
Job Stability
Career growth
The position offers a competitive salary
If you are passionate, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are ready to take your career to the next level, we would love to hear from you.

Job Details

Job Details:

Are you passionate about technology and looking for a challenging role where you can make a significant impact? We are seeking a dynamic Consulting Integration Developer to join our Tech Services team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in healthcare technology, specifically with Acute Inpatient Hospital Experience. This role is a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and to drive the integration of our systems to deliver seamless, high-quality services to our clients.

Responsibilities:

As a Consulting Integration Developer, you will be tasked with the following:

1. Develop and implement integration solutions for our clients, ensuring the seamless operation of various systems and technologies.
2. Analyze current systems and processes, identifying areas for improvement and proposing innovative solutions to enhance functionality and user experience.
3. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, software development, and healthcare professionals, to understand their needs and translate them into effective integration strategies.
4. Use your understanding of Acute Inpatient Hospital systems to ensure our solutions meet the specific needs of this environment.
5. Conduct regular system tests and troubleshooting to identify and resolve any issues, ensuring the smooth and reliable operation of our integrated systems.
6. Keep abreast of the latest industry trends and developments in healthcare technology, leveraging this knowledge to drive continuous improvement in our systems and processes.
7. Provide expert advice and guidance to clients and team members on complex integration issues, contributing to the overall knowledge and expertise of our team.

Qualifications:

To be considered for the role of Consulting Integration Developer, you should have the following:

1. A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. A Master’s degree will be an added advantage.
2. A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role, with a focus on system integration and healthcare technology.
3. Proven experience in Acute Inpatient Hospital systems, with a deep understanding of the specific requirements and challenges of this environment.
4. Strong technical skills, with proficiency in various programming languages and knowledge of integration platforms and technologies.
5. Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions to complex technical issues.
6. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
7. A commitment to continuous learning and development, with a keen interest in staying up to date with the latest industry trends and developments.

This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned professional to apply their skills and knowledge in a challenging and rewarding role. If you are passionate about healthcare technology and eager to drive the integration of systems to deliver superior services, we would love to hear from you.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Fresher BI Developer Jobs in Los Angeles
description: Find fresher BI Developer positions in Los Angeles. Entry-level opportunities for recent graduates. Apply through Cosmoquick. Hire creative tech talent in Los Angeles. Find pre-vetted designers, developers, and marketers for your LA-based company in 60 minutes.

title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
description:
Our client is a top-tier lighting manufacturer known for designing and producing premium modular downlighting systems that deliver exceptional performance, adaptability, and aesthetic appeal. Their reputation is built on a foundation of superior design, engineering innovation, and dedicated customer service.They’re seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) & Analytics Lead to own enterprise reporting, analytics strategy, and data governance across the organization. This role serves as the business-facing analytics leader, responsible for ensuring that financial, operational, manufacturing, and eCommerce data is accurate, consistent, and trusted across reporting and decision-making processes.

This position leverages Microsoft Fabric as the core analytics platform and partners closely with Finance, Operations, Manufacturing, Sales, and IT teams. The role blends strategic ownership with hands-on oversight of data models, pipelines, dashboards, and reporting standards, while coordinating delivery with offshore BI development resources. This role will play a key part in the organization’s transition to Microsoft Fabric, supporting adoption, standardization, and long-term analytics ownership.

This is a hybrid role, reporting to our client’s headquarters in Carson, CA (greater LA area) three days per week.

Responsibilities:

- Serve as the primary owner of enterprise analytics and reporting, partnering with Finance, Operations, Manufacturing, Sales, and eCommerce teams to define KPIs and reporting requirements

- Own and govern semantic models, datasets, and reporting layers within Microsoft Fabric, maintaining consistent metric definitions, calculations, and data standards

- Translate business questions into clear analytics, reporting, and dashboard specifications

- Review and validate data pipelines and transformations feeding Fabric, ensuring reports and dashboards are performant, scalable, and user friendly

- Collaborate closely with Oracle Fusion Functional Leads and the Integration and Applications Technical Lead, while partnering with eCommerce and Operations stakeholders to validate reporting requirements

- Ensure data accuracy and consistency across Oracle Fusion Finance and Supply Chain modules, CPQ platforms, Warehouse Management Systems, and both B2B and B2C eCommerce platforms

- Establish and maintain data dictionaries, KPI definitions, and reporting documentation, balancing self-service analytics with appropriate governance and controls

- Act as the escalation point for reporting, dashboard, and data quality issues, troubleshooting data discrepancies and coordinate fixes across technical teams

- Identify opportunities to automate reporting and reduce manual processes

- Provide functional direction and prioritization to offshore BI and Microsoft Fabric developers; reviewing deliverables to ensure accuracy, usability, and completeness; and participating in regular status updates, reviews, and issue-resolution meetings

Qualifications:

- 5–8 years of experience in business intelligence, analytics, or enterprise reporting roles

- Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric or Power BI within the Microsoft data ecosystem

- Experience delivering analytics and reporting on ERP and operational data with Oracle Fusion preferred

- Experience working with offshore or third-party development teams

- Exposure to manufacturing, supply chain, or financial reporting environments, strongly preferred

- Strong understanding of data modeling and semantic layer design with the ability to validate, troubleshoot, and reconcile data pipelines and dashboards

- Working knowledge of ETL and ELT concepts and data pipelines

- Experience defining KPIs, metrics, and reporting standards

- Strong communication skills with both business and technical stakeholders; highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities

- Knowledge of Power BI, Synapse, or Azure data services

- Exposure to finance and supply chain metrics, a plus

- Familiarity with CPQ and eCommerce reporting, a plus

Compensation: Targeting a base salary of $120-$130k (DOE), plus performance-based bonus

title: Senior BI Engineer - Hybrid in Los Angeles
description:
About the Role

As our client scales their digital platform and business intelligence capabilities, they are looking for a Lead BI Engineer to build and maintain the BI data infrastructure and reporting capabilities that power decision-making across Marketing, Product, Finance, and Operations. This role is crucial in developing scalable BI solutions with a strong emphasis on usability, governance, and business impact. You will be responsible for managing our Tableau reporting environment, developing the BI data layer, and enabling new BI development that empowers stakeholders with accessible and trustworthy insights.

At our client, a Senior BI Engineer is more than a dashboard builder. This role is not about "tell me what to build, and I'll create the report"-this role is about architecting and implementing the right business intelligence solutions for our stakeholders and company. Senior BI Engineers are trusted partners to business leaders and their teammates and play an important role in driving the transformation, governance, and accessibility of sweetgreen's data. They are responsible for delivering key BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities to power decision-making throughout the business. They work with data analysts, data scientists, and business partners to ensure that our business teams are empowered to take action against data.

Your Responsibilities

BI Data Layer Development and Maintenance - Design, build, and maintain the BI data layer that serves as the foundation for all reporting and analytics. Ensure data models are optimized for performance, scalability, and ease of use. Implement data quality monitoring and testing to maintain high standards of reliability.

Tableau Administration and Management - Manage and administer our Tableau environment, including server configuration, user access, permissions, and governance. Maintain existing Tableau reports and dashboards, ensuring they remain accurate, performant, and aligned with business needs. Implement best practices for Tableau development and usage across the organization.

BI Development and Enablement - Lead the development of new dashboards, reports, and visualizations in Tableau to meet evolving business requirements. Enable stakeholders to build their own analyses through well-designed data sources, calculated fields, and self-service capabilities. Establish and maintain documentation, style guides, and governance frameworks for BI development.

Business Partnership and Requirements Gathering - Serve as an embedded thought partner to Marketing, Product, Finance, and Operations teams. Translate business requirements into effective BI solutions, deliver rapid-turnaround reporting for executive decision-making, and proactively surface insights through visualization and reporting.

Technical Leadership and Cross-Functional Collaboration - Act as a technical leader within the Data & Analytics team. Guide architectural decisions on BI tooling, data modeling approaches, and reporting standards. Facilitate cross-departmental collaboration to ensure alignment of BI initiatives with business goals.

Data Flow Understanding and Architecture Input - Understand data flows across the company's tech stack (Snowflake, Brink POS, loyalty platforms, marketing tools). Identify data quality issues, integration gaps, and opportunities for new data sources. Contribute to architecture decisions on tooling, vendor selection, and data platform strategy.
Your Accomplishments & Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in BI engineering, BI development, or analytics roles, preferably in Marketing, Growth, Product, or Consumer Analytics environments
• Expert proficiency in Tableau including dashboard development, Tableau Server/Cloud administration, data source optimization, and governance frameworks
• Expert proficiency in SQL for complex data analysis, transformation, and performance optimization
• Strong experience with BI data modeling including dimensional modeling, star/snowflake schemas, and performance optimization for reporting workloads
• Experience with dbt or similar data transformation tools for building and maintaining the BI data layer
• Deep knowledge of Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouses) for BI workloads, including query optimization and cost management
• Strong business acumen with track record of partnering with non-technical stakeholders (Marketing, Product, Finance) to drive decision-making through data
• Ability to design intuitive data models and reporting solutions that empower stakeholders to answer their own questions
What you'll get:
• Highly competitive pay + bonus plan
• Three different medical plans to suit your and your family's needs
• Dental and Vision insurance
• Flexible PTO plan
• 401k program
• Employee HSA and FSA
• Complimentary greens
• An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real food
• To live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purpose
• A collaborative team of people who live our core values and have your back
• A clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionally
• Free sweetgreen swag

Come join!

About our Client

Our client is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 3,500 team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we're committed to leaving people better than we found them. We're in the business of feeding people, and we're out to change what that means.

Salary range for this role:

Starting salary range based on experience

$125,000-$150,000 USD

description:
About the Role

Since opening our doors in 2007, sweetgreen has been on a mission to build healthier communities, starting with real food. As we scale our digital platform and business intelligence capabilities, we are looking for a Lead BI Engineer to build and maintain the BI data infrastructure and reporting capabilities that power decision-making across Marketing, Product, Finance, and Operations. This role is crucial in developing scalable BI solutions with a strong emphasis on usability, governance, and business impact. You will be responsible for managing our Tableau reporting environment, developing the BI data layer, and enabling new BI development that empowers stakeholders with accessible and trustworthy insights.

At sweetgreen, a Senior BI Engineer is more than a dashboard builder. This role is not about "tell me what to build, and I'll create the report"—this role is about architecting and implementing the right business intelligence solutions for our stakeholders and company. Senior BI Engineers are trusted partners to business leaders and their teammates and play an important role in driving the transformation, governance, and accessibility of sweetgreen's data. They are responsible for delivering key BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities to power decision-making throughout the business. They work with data analysts, data scientists, and business partners to ensure that our business teams are empowered to take action against data.

Your Responsibilities

BI Data Layer Development and Maintenance — Design, build, and maintain the BI data layer that serves as the foundation for all reporting and analytics. Ensure data models are optimized for performance, scalability, and ease of use. Implement data quality monitoring and testing to maintain high standards of reliability.

Tableau Administration and Management — Manage and administer our Tableau environment, including server configuration, user access, permissions, and governance. Maintain existing Tableau reports and dashboards, ensuring they remain accurate, performant, and aligned with business needs. Implement best practices for Tableau development and usage across the organization.

BI Development and Enablement — Lead the development of new dashboards, reports, and visualizations in Tableau to meet evolving business requirements. Enable stakeholders to build their own analyses through well-designed data sources, calculated fields, and self-service capabilities. Establish and maintain documentation, style guides, and governance frameworks for BI development.

Business Partnership and Requirements Gathering — Serve as an embedded thought partner to Marketing, Product, Finance, and Operations teams. Translate business requirements into effective BI solutions, deliver rapid-turnaround reporting for executive decision-making, and proactively surface insights through visualization and reporting.

Technical Leadership and Cross-Functional Collaboration — Act as a technical leader within the Data & Analytics team. Guide architectural decisions on BI tooling, data modeling approaches, and reporting standards. Facilitate cross-departmental collaboration to ensure alignment of BI initiatives with business goals.

Data Flow Understanding and Architecture Input — Understand data flows across sweetgreen's tech stack (Snowflake, Brink POS, loyalty platforms, marketing tools). Identify data quality issues, integration gaps, and opportunities for new data sources. Contribute to architecture decisions on tooling, vendor selection, and data platform strategy.

Your Accomplishments & Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in BI engineering, BI development, or analytics roles, preferably in Marketing, Growth, Product, or Consumer Analytics environments
• Expert proficiency in Tableau including dashboard development, Tableau Server/Cloud administration, data source optimization, and governance frameworks
• Expert proficiency in SQL for complex data analysis, transformation, and performance optimization
• Strong experience with BI data modeling including dimensional modeling, star/snowflake schemas, and performance optimization for reporting workloads
• Experience with dbt or similar data transformation tools for building and maintaining the BI data layer
• Deep knowledge of Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouses) for BI workloads, including query optimization and cost management
• Strong business acumen with track record of partnering with non-technical stakeholders (Marketing, Product, Finance) to drive decision-making through data
• Ability to design intuitive data models and reporting solutions that empower stakeholders to answer their own questions

What you'll get:
• Highly competitive pay + bonus plan
• Three different medical plans to suit your and your family's needs
• Dental and Vision insurance
• Flexible PTO plan
• 401k program
• Employee HSA and FSA
• Complimentary greens
• An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real food
• To live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purpose
• A collaborative team of people who live our core values and have your back
• A clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionally
• Free sweetgreen swag

Come join the sweetlife!

About sweetgreen

sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 3,500 team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we’re committed to leaving people better than we found them. We’re in the business of feeding people, and we’re out to change what that means.

sweetgreen provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.

sweetgreen participates in the federal government's E-Verify program to determine employment eligibility. To learn more about the E-Verify program, please click here.
Salary range for this role:
Starting salary range based on experience
$125,000—$150,000 USD

Sweetgreen provides equal opportunities for all employees and applicants, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race (including traits historically associated with race, such as hair texture and protective hairstyles), religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service in the uniformed services of the United States, or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.

California residents: Review our applicant privacy notice HERE.

description:
Responsibilities Design develop bank wide dashboard using PowerBI. Design develop and maintain reports ad hoc queries and analytical tools. Produce metrics and other report objects and components. Perform ongoing monitoring automation and refinement of reports and PowerBI. Work with BI Management to identify and resolve data related issues. Work with business departmental teams to help them define and document business requirements for new metrics and reports. Provide analysis and issue resolution on business reported concerns. Participate in design and delivery of dashboards and various self-service business intelligence solutions.

Qualifications 5+ years of hands on experience working with large scale databases. Requires 3 years of SQL Server BI development experience. Solid T-SQL knowledge SQL query development using MS SQL. Thorough understanding of relational databases and Kimball Methodology. Team Foundation Server or a similar source control software experience. Good business understanding and ability to convert complex business needs into efficient and accurate queries.

Key Skills Data visualization. Strong analytical. Problem-solving skills. SQL. Data warehousing. Soft skills like communication collaboration.

description:
Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled QlikView / Qlik Sense Developer to build, optimize, and maintain data visualization applications that support enterprise reporting and business analytics. The ideal candidate will have hands-on expertise in both QlikView and Qlik Sense, strong data modeling experience, and the ability to translate business requirements into actionable BI solutions.

Location: Open to relocation anywhere in the United States (onsite/hybrid/remote depending on client)
Employment Type: W-2 Contract / Contract-to-Hire
Citizenship Requirement: US Citizen (USC) or Green Card holder ONLY

Key Responsibilities
• Develop end-to-end BI solutions using QlikView and Qlik Sense
• Create data load scripts, ETL logic, and optimized data models
• Design and deploy interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations
• Perform performance tuning for data models and dashboard rendering
• Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to define requirements
• Support ongoing production issues and implement enhancements
• Document technical specs, data flows, and system architecture
• Assist in QA, UAT and deployment activities

Required Skills
• 1 to 4 years of QlikView and Qlik Sense development
• Strong proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and ETL
• Experience with data warehousing, SSIS, SQL Server, Oracle or similar
• Solid understanding of business analytics and KPIs
• Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities
• Strong problem solving and communication skills

Preferred
• Experience with REST APIs and integrations
• Knowledge of scripting languages (Python, Bash)
• Exposure to cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure)
